content.raw:
Well, this has happened with many different launch commands. I don’t recall which one I used before getting that screenshot. Here is what I’ve been trying to run today \(with the same problem\):

ign launch -v 4 virtual\_stix.ign robotName1:=X3 robotConfig1:=X1\_SENSOR\_CONFIG\_1 robotName2:=X2 robotConfig2:=X1\_SENSOR\_CONFIG\_1 robotName3:=X1 robotConfig3:=X1\_SENSOR\_CONFIG\_4

`ign launch -v 4 competition.ign robotName1:=X3 robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG_1 robotName2:=X2 robotConfig2:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG_1 robotName3:=X1 robotConfig3:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG_4`

ign launch -v 4 competition.ign robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=X1\_SENSOR\_CONFIG\_4

issue.title: Problems stopping all processes associated with ignition

content.raw:
Sarah, Derek,

The same was happening to me last week, but I cannot reproduce it anymore after rebuilding my workspace. Can you run the commands below and try it again?

> cd ~/.ignition/fuel/fuel.ignitionrobotics.org/openrobotics/models/
>
> rm -rfv \*
>
> cd ~/subt\_ws/src/tunnel\_circuit
>
> hg pull && hg up
>
> cd ~/subt\_ws
>
> catkin\_make install
>
> ign launch -v 4 competition.ign robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=X1\_SENSOR\_CONFIG\_2

NOTE: The GUI will present you with empty panels for a few minutes until the models are downloaded.
content.html:
Sarah, Derek,

The same was happening to me last week, but I cannot reproduce it anymore after rebuilding my workspace. Can you run the commands below and try it again?

cd ~/.ignition/fuel/fuel.ignitionrobotics.org/openrobotics/models/

rm -rfv *

cd ~/subt_ws/src/tunnel_circuit

hg pull && hg up

cd ~/subt_ws

catkin_make install

ign launch -v 4 competition.ign robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG_2

NOTE: The GUI will present you with empty panels for a few minutes until the models are downloaded.

killall rosmaster roslaunch parameter_bridge ukf_localization_node roll_pitch_yawrate_thrust_controller_node
kill -9 $(pgrep ign)

issue.title: Problems stopping all processes associated with ignition

content.raw: I generally have the same problem.  I installed the catkin\_ws version of ignition gazebo on Wednesday of this week.  The simulator is working in general, but I have to kill processes like Derek mentions above.  Sometimes even that doesn’t seem to be enough, and I have to reboot the computer to get the vehicles to launch again.  The problem seems worst when I close the ignition window early on…if I’ve run the simulator for a few minutes, it sometimes doesn’t happen.
content.html: I generally have the same problem. I installed the catkin_ws version of ignition gazebo on Wednesday of this week. The simulator is working in general, but I have to kill processes like Derek mentions above. Sometimes even that doesn’t seem to be enough, and I have to reboot the computer to get the vehicles to launch again. The problem seems worst when I close the ignition window early on…if I’ve run the simulator for a few minutes, it sometimes doesn’t happen.

issue.title: Problems stopping all processes associated with ignition

content.raw: Currently, closing the GUI window does not terminate the rest of the simulation.  To stop the simulation, use `ctrl-c` in the terminal where `ign launch` was started.
content.html: Currently, closing the GUI window does not terminate the rest of the simulation. To stop the simulation, use ctrl-c in the terminal where ign launch was started.

issue.title: Problems stopping all processes associated with ignition

content.raw:
At least one deadlock issue was introduced at shutdown via [#!/osrf/subt/pull-requests/184](#!/osrf/subt/pull-requests/184) and was resolved via [#!/osrf/subt/pull-requests/194/fixing-a-deadlock-i-introduced-in-the-base/diff](#!/osrf/subt/pull-requests/194/fixing-a-deadlock-i-introduced-in-the-base/diff)

At this point, I can’t seem to reproduce this behavior locally, but since the issue was opened before #184 was merged, I can’t be confident that #184 was the only factor.  If you continue to see issues after #194, please let me know, so that I can work on constructing a case that consistently reproduces the bug.
content.html:
At least one deadlock issue was introduced at shutdown via #!/osrf/subt/pull-requests/184 and was resolved via #!/osrf/subt/pull-requests/194/fixing-a-deadlock-i-introduced-in-the-base/diff

At this point, I can’t seem to reproduce this behavior locally, but since the issue was opened before #184 was merged, I can’t be confident that #184 was the only factor. If you continue to see issues after #194, please let me know, so that I can work on constructing a case that consistently reproduces the bug.

issue.title: Problems stopping all processes associated with ignition

content.raw:
Michael’s [changes](#!/osrf/subt/pull-requests/194) to fix the problem have been merged so update your local repo to grab them.

```
cd ~/subt_ws/src/tunnel_circuit
hg pull && hg up
cd ~/subt_ws catkin_make install

# To test:
ign launch -v 4 competition.ign robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG_2
```

content.raw:
Thanks for your work on this issue @{557058:65740f22-cc56-4418-9608-7e17d0ed47b7}

I updated the subt repository as suggested and deleted the build/ devel/ install/ folders for good measure before running `catkin_make install`.

I still occasionally have processes labeled `/usr/bin/ruby /usr/bin/ign launch -v 4 competition.ign robotName1:=X4 robotConfig1:=X4_SENSOR_CONFIG_2` running even after I `ctrl+C` and close the terminal where that command was run. Let me know if a log file would help.

ign processes are the only offenders I’ve noticed since your update. I haven’t seen any `rosmaster roslaunch parameter_bridge ukf_localization_node roll_pitch_yawrate_thrust_controller_node` processes still running.

issue.title: Problems stopping all processes associated with ignition

content.raw: We found a second deadlock that can affect the bringup portion of the process.  In this case, `ign-launch` will hang when launching processes, and can only be killed with `SIGTERM` or higher.  This ends up leaving a few of the residual processes around that we’ve been seeing.  This PR \([https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-launch/pull-requests/36/eliminate-potential-deadlock-from-sigchld/diff](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-launch/pull-requests/36/eliminate-potential-deadlock-from-sigchld/diff)\) should address the deadlock on the way up.
content.html: We found a second deadlock that can affect the bringup portion of the process. In this case, ign-launch will hang when launching processes, and can only be killed with SIGTERM or higher. This ends up leaving a few of the residual processes around that we’ve been seeing. This PR (https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-launch/pull-requests/36/eliminate-potential-deadlock-from-sigchld/diff) should address the deadlock on the way up.

issue.title: Problems stopping all processes associated with ignition

content.raw:
You can ether install the new Docker image by following the instructions in the link below:

```
      `#!/osrf/subt/wiki/tutorials/SystemSetupDockerhub`
```

Or run the commands below to update your catkin environment.

```
sudo apt update && sudo apt upgrade -y
sudo reboot

cd ~/subt_ws/src/tunnel_circuithgpull && hg update tunnel_circuit

source /opt/ros/melodic/setup.bash

rm -rfv ~/.ignition/fuel/fuel.ignitionrobotics.org/openrobotics/models/*

cd ~/subt_ws/catkin_make install
. ~/subt_ws/install/setup.bash
ign launch -v 4 competition.ign robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG_2

Open another terminal and run these commands:

. /opt/ros/melodic/setup.bash
. ~/subt_ws/install/setup.bash

roslaunch subt_example teleop.launch
```
content.html:
You can ether install the new Docker image by following the instructions in the link below:

      `#!/osrf/subt/wiki/tutorials/SystemSetupDockerhub`

Or run the commands below to update your catkin environment.

sudo apt update && sudo apt upgrade -y
sudo reboot

cd ~/subt_ws/src/tunnel_circuithgpull && hg update tunnel_circuit

source /opt/ros/melodic/setup.bash

rm -rfv ~/.ignition/fuel/fuel.ignitionrobotics.org/openrobotics/models/*

cd ~/subt_ws/catkin_make install
. ~/subt_ws/install/setup.bash
ign launch -v 4 competition.ign robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG_2

Open another terminal and run these commands:

. /opt/ros/melodic/setup.bash
. ~/subt_ws/install/setup.bash

roslaunch subt_example teleop.launch

issue.title: Problems stopping all processes associated with ignition

content.raw:
It starts a lot things and it takes a lot of time \(almost a minute\) and there is no message in the output \(or somewhere else?\) that would say something along the lines “I am done loading and starting all the stuff, feel free to start up your controller”. Since I was just testing if the X window appears, I killed it quite early.

I had a script for gazebo9 that would wait for a certain topic to appear to take a guess when it is done loading.

Since I was just testing if the X window appears, I killed it quite early.

I had a script for gazebo9 that would wait for a certain topic to appear to take a guess when it is done loading.
